title: Arrival & Blue Lagoon

image.alt: Blue Lagoon geothermal spa with its milky blue waters

quote.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
quote.author: Lao Tzu

summary: Begin your Icelandic adventure with a rejuvenating visit to the world-famous Blue Lagoon before heading to vibrant Reykjavík. After arriving at Keflavík Airport, you'll pick up your rental car, enjoy breakfast, and then immerse yourself in the milky blue waters of this geothermal wonder. In the afternoon, you'll drive to Reykjavík to check into your centrally located hotel, meet with Heather and family, and explore the city's iconic landmarks including Hallgrímskirkja church and the striking Harpa Concert Hall.

schedule.description: Welcome to Iceland! After landing, proceed to collect your luggage.
Take advantage of significantly cheaper prices at the airport duty-free shop.

schedule.activity: Pick up rental car from Blue Car Rental
schedule.description: Collect your Suzuki Vitara 4WD from Blue Car Rental (confirmation: RVF6FW).
Enjoy your first meal in Iceland at this trendy bistro near the airport. Kitchen opens at 11:30am.
Relax in the world-famous geothermal spa with milky blue waters. Pre-booking essential.
Drive approximately 45 minutes to your accommodation in the capital city.
Stock up on essentials at Bonus or Kronan supermarkets.
Check in at your central accommodation located on Laugavegur 22A.

schedule.activity: Meet up with Heather and family
schedule.description: Connect with Heather and family who are already in Reykjavík.
Visit key attractions like Hallgrímskirkja church, Harpa Concert Hall, and Sun Voyager sculpture.
schedule.cost: Free for exterior views, small fee for Hallgrímskirkja tower

schedule.description: Enjoy a group dinner at Café Loki or another local restaurant near Hallgrímskirkja.

highlights.title: Blue Lagoon
highlights.description: One of 25 wonders of the world, this geothermal spa offers a unique experience with its milky blue waters rich in minerals like silica and sulfur. Includes amenities such as a sauna, steam room, and in-water bar.

highlights.title: Hallgrímskirkja Church
highlights.description: Reykjavík's iconic landmark and the largest church in Iceland, offering panoramic views of the city from its tower.

highlights.title: Harpa Concert Hall
highlights.description: A stunning modern architectural marvel on Reykjavík's harbor with a distinctive colored glass facade inspired by Iceland's basalt landscape.

highlights.title: Sun Voyager Sculpture
highlights.description: An elegant stainless steel sculpture resembling a Viking ship, located along Reykjavík's waterfront with views of Mount Esja.

accommodation.name: Hotel Fron
accommodation.description: Centrally located hotel on Laugavegur, Reykjavík's main shopping street.

alternatives.title: Perlan Museum
alternatives.description: Interactive museum featuring exhibits about Iceland's nature, including a man-made ice cave and planetarium.

alternatives.title: Laugardalslaug Swimming Pool
alternatives.description: The largest swimming pool complex in Reykjavík featuring outdoor pools, hot tubs, and water slides.

alternatives.title: Grotta Lighthouse & Beach Walk
alternatives.description: Scenic lighthouse at the tip of the Seltjarnarnes Peninsula with a beautiful coastal walking path.

alternatives.title: Whales of Iceland Exhibition
alternatives.description: The largest whale exhibition in Europe, featuring life-size models of the various whale species found around Iceland.

alternatives.title: FlyOver Iceland
alternatives.description: Immersive flight simulation experience that takes you on a journey over Iceland's most stunning landscapes.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: National Museum of Iceland
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Comprehensive collection showcasing Iceland's cultural history from settlement to present day.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Kolaportið Flea Market
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Indoor market offering a variety of Icelandic foods, clothing, antiques, and souvenirs.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Reykjavík Art Museum
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Contemporary art museum spread across three different locations in the city.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Settlement Exhibition
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Archaeological museum built around the remains of a Viking longhouse from the 10th century.

tip: Purchase alcohol at the duty-free shop in the airport, as prices are significantly cheaper than in town. Also, pre-book your Blue Lagoon visit as it often sells out, especially during peak summer season.
notes: Heather and family will meet you in Reykjavík. You should check the opening hours for downtown attractions as some may close early. The Blue Lagoon asks guests to shower before entering, and the silica in the water can be harsh on hair, so apply the provided conditioner before entering the lagoon.
